intro: Arabis arenosa subsp. petraea, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock arabis, is a perennial flowering plant native to rocky and arid regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rocky slopes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are white or pale pink, with four petals, and appear in spring, contributing to its ecological role in pollination.
